newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sakakibara worried at foreign bond investment - Jiji.
newsitem.headline: Sakakibara worried at foreign bond investment - Jiji.

text.p: Senior Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara told a parliamentary committee meeting on Thursday he is worried about increasing investments in foreign bonds by Japanese investors, Japanese news agency Jiji reported.

Sakakibara, director-general of the ministry's International Finance Bureau, made the remarks when asked if planned reforms of Japan's foreign exchange regulations next April would lead to capital outflows from Japan.
"Transactions in foreign currencies entail currency risks. Japanese investments in foreign bonds are increasing, and we are worried about this," Sakakibara was quoted by Jiji as saying.

"There are some foreign bonds which carry interest rates of five to six percent. But they would not yield anything if the yen were to rise by six yen against the dollar. Investments must be made with sufficient consideration given to foreign exchange risks," he was quoted as saying.
